intro: Leptocarpus oxylepis, commonly known as the slender-leafed sea bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to coastal regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or white. It thrives in sandy or muddy soils near the shoreline, often in brackish or saltwater environments. Leptocarpus oxylepis is adapted to tidal zones and plays a role in stabilizing coastal sediments.
